CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Offer Accepted stage positioned above or below the Offer Extended stage?
SRP.A: The Offer Accepted stage is positioned {below} the Offer Extended stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Offer Extended?
VE.A: The value of stage Offer Extended is {15%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Application Submitted?
VE.A: The value of stage Application Submitted is {100%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Offer Accepted?
VE.A: The value of stage Offer Accepted is {13%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Application Submitted, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Offer Accepted, with a value of {13%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen is {39%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended is {7%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Offer Extended to stage Offer Accepted?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Offer Extended to stage Offer Accepted is {2%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 80%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 14%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 18% and 49%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {HR Interview} stage has {38%}, the {Technical Interview} stage has {22%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview, or from stage Offer Extended to Offer Accepted?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Phone Screen} to {HR Interview} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview, from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended, or from stage Application Submitted to Phone Screen?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Application Submitted} to stage {Phone Screen} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Application Submitted} and {Phone Screen} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Offer Extended} and {Offer Accepted} stages.
